intro: Esenbeckia intermedia, commonly known as Brazilian burr cucumber, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its hairy, trailing stems and distinctive, spiny fruits that resemble small cucumbers. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Esenbeckia intermedia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
